general.headline: Head of Pro Bono & Community Impact at King & Wood Mallesons
general.description:
Daniel is Head of Pro Bono & Community Impact at King & Wood Mallesons leading a team of pro bono & social impact experts via the KWM Community Impact program (pro bono, volunteering, philanthropy & reconciliation).

Daniel is a leading pro bono, community and responsible business lawyer and was named in the 2016 Hot List by Australasian Lawyer magazine. He has been a speaker at the International Bar Association Conference in Sydney, the Asia Pro Bono Conference in Myanmar and Indonesia, the PBI Conference in the United States, the National Pro Bono & A2J Conference in Sydney and the NACLC Conferences in Brisbane & Melbourne. Daniel is often quoted in the legal and mainstream press including The Age, LIJ, Boardroom Radio, Lawyers Weekly, Brisbane Legal and ADVOC News. He has written various articles that have been published in the LIJ, Governance Directions and My Business.  

Daniel's primary areas of practice include: Poverty Law (housing/tenancy rights, domestic violence, credit & debt and victims compensation); Public Interest Law/Human Rights Litigation; Insurance Litigation (defence/claims work); and Practice Management (pro bono, charities & legal centres).  

Daniel has developed considerable expertise in acting for (and assisting) CLCs, charities and non-profit organisations, as well as insurers & corporations. He has built a substantial practice advising and assisting charitable institutions and is a trusted advisor to many of the largest charities, non-profits and CLCs in Australia.  Daniel has highly developed skills in strategy planning and implementation, communications and engagement. 

Daniel has been involved in devising and delivering significant pro bono, volunteering & community engagement projects, with large teams of people and in a variety of jurisdictions, including Australia, South Africa, Myanmar, Thailand, China, Japan, Laos, Cambodia, Hong Kong, Samoa, Papua New Guinea, the Cook Islands, Timor Leste and the Solomon Islands.

general.headline: Commercial lawyer | 亚太 |  Solicitor at Herbert Smith Freehills
general.description:
亚太 = "Asia Pacific".

Country with the largest economy in South East Asia? Indonesia. Total amount invested by Chinese business leaders to acquire companies abroad in 2016? AU$298 billion. 

It’s no wonder that businesses are looking to invest internationally more than ever. The economic growth of the Asia-Pacific region has significantly surpassed growth of Western Countries in recent years, creating opportunities for diversification and partnerships. The challenge is to retain the right people - the right lawyers - who understand and appreciate different business cultures and practices. 

I am passionate about assisting clients based in Asia solve legal problems in the Australian jurisdiction and vice-versa. I am able to speak Bahasa Indonesia and I am currently learning Chinese Mandarin to further my skills. Whilst studying on university exchange in Hong Kong in 2014, I further developed my passion by studying Chinese Law and Banking Law in Hong Kong.

As a Solicitor currently rotating through the Disputes team at Herbert Smith Freehills in Perth, I have gained experience assisting with commercial litigation, client matters involving bribery and corruption and international arbitrations. I am particularly interested in the unique issues that arise in international arbitration proceedings, cross border transactions and international investment.

I previously spent 6 months in the Corporate team assisting on client matters in the energy and resources sector with project acquisition and divestment, transaction structuring and M&A. As a member of the Herbert Smith Freehills Perth China Team, I am responsible for promoting a greater understanding of doing business in China within the Australian offices and developing our relationships within the Australian-Chinese business community.

If I can assist you in any way, please contact me at emily.purvis@hsf.com

jobs.description:
The 1,700km route will link Melbourne and Brisbane via regional Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland. The route uses the existing interstate line from Melbourne, Victoria to Illabo, New South Wales, which will be enhanced to accommodate double-stacked trains allowing them to carry up to twice as many containers.

A combination of new and upgraded tracks will then be used via Parkes, Moree, Toowoomba and Calvert, to reach the existing interstate line at Kagaru, south of Brisbane.

As part of the 2017-18 Budget, the Australian Government announced its commitment to the full delivery of Inland Rail with an additional $8.4 billion equity investment in the Australian Rail Track Corporation. Building on the equity investment, the Government will utilise an innovative Public Private Partnership (PPP) funding arrangement to deliver the funding required to complete the project.

This funding approach will enable the Government to leverage private sector expertise in the design, finance, build and maintenance of the most technically complex section–Toowoomba to Kagaru (Brisbane)–which includes the construction of approximately 8.9 kilometres of tunnels through the Toowoomba Range.

general.headline: Director, Cullen Macleod Lawyers
general.description:
As one of the 2 owners of Cullen Macleod Lawyers, along with my co-director Rick Cullen, our team of 29 can assist you and your business in a broad variety of ways. From general business advice, to documents and representation across a variety of areas (think property, buy and sell, restraint of trade, liquor licensing and franchising to name a few). 

Collaboration is key to our approach - we collaborate across each of our internal specialist teams, and externally with consultants and other legal advisors, to give you the best expertise to assist whatever issues you or your business are facing. Personally, I help individuals, SMEs and national businesses in  resolving commercial disputes. I have a particular interest in property, construction and franchising disputes.

My main focus, and that of all of our lawyers, is understanding that the best 'legal' answer is not necessarily the best way forward. In most cases practicality, ongoing business considerations and general common sense are equally important. The ability to collaborate with other expert professionals assists to produce a more successful and lasting outcome.  The ability to write in clear and simple language is also a major focus for all of us at Cullen Macleod. 

My experience before Cullen Macleod included working in mining camps, at the Law Reform Commission of WA, teaching at Murdoch University Law School and working for the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court Western Australia.  I am currently a  member of various Boards and Committees including the Austral Asia Centre for Legal Innovation, Piddington Society,  Western Suburbs Business Association, Business Advisory Council Autism Association of WA, Subiaco Community Legal Centre.

I have a particular interest in how the legal services industry is changing, and how technology and new ways of working can bring greater efficiency and better outcomes to clients, and more interesting and satisfying work to those within the legal  industry.

jobs.description:
At Impact Seed, we are capacity builders focused on growing impact investment in conversation with impact businesses, government, CSR and private wealth, and demonstrating why the ‘business for good’ model works in bridging investment and philanthropy. 

Impact investment has the capacity to create solutions to society’s biggest problems through the power of the markets, and the Social Businesses we set out to nurture are investable enterprises, with a clear social impact mission front and centre.  

We’re passionate about social innovation, creating sustainable social impact and creating a working space for Social Businesses to be identified, supported and to thrive.  We want to build the pool of investment, and the number of investments in Social Businesses that can provide market-rate return to investors and social impact at once.

60% of HNWI’s see driving social impact with their investments as ‘extremely or very important’ and an overwhelming majority of under 40’s are conscious consumers.  In this environment, it simply makes sense for Social Businesses to enjoy market share uplift, improved defensibility and investor returns. 

“When they discover that they have a conscious competitor, traditional companies are likely to find that their ability to attract customers, employees, investors and suppliers will diminish greatly.” (Ernst & Young – Conscious Capitalism)

general.headline: Lawyer
general.description:
I am an Australian Qualified Lawyer with over seven years of commercial and legal experience in a range of contentious and non-contentious matters. 

I am experienced in reviewing, drafting, negotiating and advising on a range of low, medium and high value commercial, construction and engineering contracts. I have also acted in contentious matters in the Magistrates, District, Supreme and Federal Courts involving contractual breaches, misleading and deceptive conduct, debt recovery, public liability incidents, property damage, professional indemnity and product liability. I have appeared in negotiations, chamber matters, pre-trial conferences, conciliations, mediations and arbitrations. I have acted for individuals, small and medium sized businesses and multinational corporations. 

I graduated with a Bachelor of Laws from The University of Western Australia in 2010 and a Master of Construction Law from Melbourne Law School in 2015. My research interests include contract law, construction law, insurance law, dispute resolution and arbitration. My written works have appeared in national and international legal publications and I am a recipient of Melbourne Law School's Student Published Research Prize. 

I am admitted to the Supreme Court of Western Australia, High Court of Australia and Chartered Institute of Arbitrators.

general.headline: Co-founder and CEO at Afterpay
general.description:
Nick Molnar is a serial entrepreneur with extensive experience in online retail. Nick is co-founder and CEO of Afterpay Holdings Ltd, a leading Australian retail payments innovator and one of Australia’s fastest growing fintech companies. Afterpay facilitates commerce between retail merchants and their end-customers - offering a ‘buy now, take now, pay later’ service that does not require end-customers to enter into a traditional loan or pay any upfront fees or interest to Afterpay. Afterpay currently has over 1.5+ million customers and over 14,000+ retail merchants. Afterpay listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in May 2016. 

Prior to establishing Afterpay, Nick launched the leading American online jeweller, Ice.com, into Australia under the local brand Iceonline.com.au. Given Nick’s family has been in the Australian jewellery industry for the past 30 years, he was able to combine specialised local product knowledge with technical online marketing expertise to exploit on the gap in the market. Nick successfully grew Ice in Australia to become the largest online-only jewellery and watch retailer. 

Nick has worked as an Investment Analyst at venture capital fund M. H. Carnegie & Co., where he was primarily responsible for growth stage investments.

jobs.description:
Afterpay is the new way for Australians to pay. Our easy-to-use payment process allows shoppers to buy their product today and pay it off in 4 equal fortnightly instalments. Afterpay believes in evolving the retail status quo to provide customers a better way to shop.  Through Australian innovation, Afterpay has evolved layby enabling shoppers to buy more of what they love, more often. Launched in 2014, Afterpay floated on the Australian Stock Exchange in May 2016 and partners with hundreds of Australia’s leading retailers such as Myer, The Iconic, Officeworks, Big W, General Pants, Glue, Topshop and Toys R Us to name a few. We're excited to now be available both online and in-store. Visit Afterpay.com.au for more information.

general.headline: VP Operations at Expert360 {We're Hiring!}
general.description:
The gig economy is part of most of our daily personal routines, and it's increasingly becoming part of our professional working lives in the form of online freelance marketplaces. Contingent Talent is expected to make up 40% of most corporates by 2020, and on-demand talent marketplaces are paving the way.  

As the speed of change in the market continues to increase, business priorities are constantly shifting, making it challenging to maintain a steady permanent workforce. Technology is also driving a major shift from ownership to access. With services like Netflix, Spotify, Airbnb and Uber, we get all the benefits of ownership at a lower cost, with greater convenience and without the liabilities associated with ownership. White collar talent and services are no different. Instead of ‘owning’ talent, in the form of a full-time hire, businesses can now access talent from around the world and in a way that enables them to scale more quickly and cost-effectively, and access specialist talent to keep them competitive.

general.headline: Co-founder & CEO @ Weploy | Creating a fearless and empowered future of work where people can work to live!
general.description:
For years I had a dream to be a Jiu Jitsu world champion. I trained day and night, and even fought twice at the world championships. But unfortunately, that dream never became true. 

When I think back on my journey and ask my self why, it all pinpointed down to one thing; fear.

I was so fearful of leaving my stable job and corporate salary that I was never able to truly commit, and train fearlessly. 

This is why Weploy exists; to create a fearless and empowered future of work where people can work to live!

Since its launch, we've been able to empower countless job seekers, or as we like to call them, Weployees, to work thousands of hours with organisations such as PwC, Lonely Planet, Catch Group, Slack, VicSuper and many more.

If you'd like to find out how your organisation can focus on what matters through quality, prevetted on-demand staff, please visit www.weployapp.com or reach out directly!

#TheFutureofWork #Weploy

jobs.description:
With a goal to create a fearless and empowered future of work where people can work to live, Weploy created a simple online platform that connects businesses with short term staffing issues to a community of empowered & pre-vetted on-demand support staff, empowering them to focus on what matters. 

The process is simple; a Weployer requests a Weployee, within seconds a pre-screened Weployee accepts the job and finally payment is managed directly through the platform. 

By cutting out traditional, timely and tired recruitment agencies we’re able to provide higher quality staff at a faster speed all while reducing your costs.

Skill sets are emphasised over job titles so Weployers know there’ll be an organised and experienced Weployee ready to get the job done the moment they walk in the door. 

Some of our current clients include: CatchGroup, Lonely Planet, Mecca, Nandos, Slack & PWC

general.headline: CEO & Founder at Flamingo AI Ltd (ASX: FGO)
general.description:
Dr Catriona Wallace is an entrepreneur in the Artificial Intelligence field. Catriona is the CEO & Founder of high-profile Artificial Intelligence FinTech and ASX Listed company (ASX: FGO) Flamingo AI. 

Flamingo AI provides unique machine learning based Cognitive Virtual Assistants, ROSIE and MAGGIE, that large Financial Services companies deploy to improve online sales conversion rates and improve customer service efficiency. Flamingo AI also provides LIBBY (short for self organizing library) which analyzes large volumes of unstructured conversational based text as well as the 'Brain', the machine learning engine that other tech companies can use to power their customer interactions. Clients include Fortune 100 and ASX 100 financial services companies.

Based in NYC and Sydney, Dr Wallace has been acknowledged as one of Australia's 100 Most Influential Women, was recently awarded Australia's top Woman in Finance award and is Advance Australia's winner of the expats working abroad Technology & Innovation award.

Catriona is also one of the world’s most cited experts on the Future of Customer Experience, Artificial Intelligence and Bot Strategy. Catriona also sits on the Board of AADL.

Catriona has a PhD in Organizational Behavior:Human Technology Interaction and has founded three other businesses - customer experience design firm, Fifth Quadrant, market research firm, ACA Research and women’s co-working space, The Ventura. Catriona is also a high profile philanthropist, human rights activist and mother of five.

Specialties: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Digital Transformation; Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Experience Design & Research (Global), Innovation, Outsourcing and IT Tender Management; Data Analytics; Big Data; Multi-channel Strategy;  Contact Centre Service Operation; Customer Experience Analyst; Contact Centre Industry Benchmarking Studies (Asia Pacific and Nth America), Location Assessments, Investment Attraction

general.location: Parliament House, New South Wales, Australia
general.description:
Passionate about the world where finance meets technology and building Zip brick by brick.

At Zip, we create simple, fair and transparent payment and credit solutions for all Australians. That’s why we offer Zip (Zip Pay, Zip Money) and Pocketbook.

Zip Pay is a friendly, interest free payment solution for everyday spending, and Zip Money is great for life’s bigger buys.

With Zip, it’s win-win. Customers love the freedom and flexibility we offer them. Our retail partners enjoy providing the best customer-experience at checkout. And to help everyone better manage their money, our award-winning Pocketbook App lets people track, budget and save.

Over 1.2 million users have engaged with Zip and we’re available online and instore at more than 10,000 retailers.

We love to tackle things with a fresh and innovative approach, and we celebrate collaboration and teamwork. Every day, we inspire and motivate each other to do the things that haven’t been done before.

We are listed on the Australian Stock Exchange under Zip Co Limited (ticker: Z1P). You can find out more by visiting zip.co and getpocketbook.com

#ownit #ownthewayyoupay

jobs.description:
Zip Co Limited (ASX: ZML) is an ASX-listed provider of innovative payment and credit solutions to retailers (online and in-store) across the digital checkout. We employ the latest tools in fraud prevention, risk management and social scoring to deliver real-time decisions to savvy digital shoppers. 

Zip is FOR Australian business. We help retailers convert browsers into paid customers (+20%), increase basket sizes (+50%) and encourage repeat shopping behaviour (+50%). There are now over 1 million users of our core products.

Zip has three core products: 

(1) zipPay - Digital wallet (up to $1,000) that helps customers buy now and pay later for everyday purchases online and in-store (fashion, hospitality, CE/IT products) with no interest ever. See www.zippay.com.au

(2) zipMoney - Digital wallet (up to $30,000) that helps customers buy now and pay later for life’s larger purchases online and in-store (CE/IT, travel, lifestyle) with healthy interest-free periods. See www.zipmoney.com.au

(3) Pocketbook - The free Pocketbook mobile app helps you get smart with your money. It automatically categorises your spending (eg clothes, groceries) to help you reach your financial goals.
See www.getpocketbook.com

We currently operate in the retail, education, health and travel markets across the omni-channel

Zip is funded by $400m in institutional funding from a range of parties including NAB to support its payment operations. We have a strong focus on responsible financial services - Zip holds both an Australian Financial Services Licence and an Australian Credit Licence.

Client advisory, principal and angel investments with a bias towards financial services and technology accounts.

My name is Elise Natalie Duncan and I am an International, Perth/Australia based Model, TV Host and Actress.

Currently I am the World Titleholder and Official Ambassador for Tropic Beauty Model Search 2015, one of the most prestigious swimsuit and calendar model search competitions in the world.

As a Model I am available in the areas of Photographic, Runway, Editorial and Commercial modeling. I have featured internationally in magazines, editorials and pageants. Recently I featured on television show Bikini Destinations TV as an international model, I am the March Model of the Month with BikiniTeam.TV and last year I was cast as three leads in short films in Australia. I have engaged in a lot of courses over the past couple of years to develop and hone my acting and presenting skills.

I hope to inspire and motivate others to follow their dreams and to embrace all opportunities that life has to offer. I hope through my blog and also through BTS videos and future campaigns that you will get an idea of the person I am behind my photos.

Elise Natalie catapulted into the modelling industry and has branded herself as a “Freelance Model”. A lot of Elise’s work is sourced from recommendations through the industry and she is rebooked regularly due to exceeding her client’s expectations in all aspects, particularly receiving comments on the way she conducts herself professionally, her work ethic and her glamorous looks.

Elise has a strong focus on being a role model for younger women. Through encouraging a healthy and fit lifestyle through her social media, mentoring and encouraging girls who come to her for modelling advice and voicing her opinion on the environment and cruelty against animals she has managed to affect the lives of many young girls who are striving to follow down the same path she is. 

Elise has extensive experience within the industry and has had the pleasure of working with international and national well-known Australia designers, earned numerous modelling titles, represented herself in Australian and International pageants and seeks to encourage and maintain client relationships. Her campaigns, catalogues and runway parades include representing brands such as Fara Couture Collection, well-known lingerie label Bra’s N Things, Perth’s own internationally renowned designer Ruth Tarvydas, G-Star Clothing, Myer Clothing, Veve Swimwear and Kooey Swimwear.

jobs.description:
Captivating Melbourne Burlesque artist Sina King takes centre stage in this
      kaleidoscopic exploration of dance, fashion and art.
      

    
      

    Collaborating with multi-faceted artist Jake Stollery, these two talented Melburnian
      creatives combine sensual silhouettes with dynamic animation and an ever-changing
      
      palette of fashion textiles to create a stylish suite of graphic projections.

Sina was the third woman in Australian history to be invited to compete for the
      industries most coveted award at the Burlesque Hall of Fame in Las Vegas, Nevada.
      
      Only ten artists from around the world are invited each year.

Known as 'The Royal Captivator', Sina King is regarded as one of Australia’s best burlesque artists has performed on the biggest burlesque stages in the world.
As creative powerhouse, King began her career in 2011 after her first performance saw her crowned winner of Australia’s prestigious ‘Miss Burlesque Australia’ taking the industry and the media by storm.  In June 2015, King represented the Southern Hemisphere in Las Vegas at the world ‘s largest and most revered burlesque event where she competed for ‘Reigning Queen of Burlesque'.
King's high glamour and unique performances have been seen at at A-list events, private parties of Cirque du Soleil, the Viennese Life Ball, on 42nd Street, many historical European theatres, international festivals, and of course, The Burlesque Hall of Fame in Las Vegas.
Despite her globetrotting, King loves her home country and has toured performing in every major city and has inspired many as coach and mentor along the way.  Off stage, King is a passionate modern pinup, producer, and Creative Director. 
Sina is available for bookings via her website www.misssinaking.com or email management@misssinaking.com

Rio Tinto Group is a British-Australian multinational metals and mining corporation, founded in 1873, with headquarters in London, UK and a management office in Melbourne, Australia. As of March 2009, Rio Tinto is the fourth-largest publicly listed mining company in the world, and is listed in Fortune magazine's 2012 Global 500 ranking of largest worldwide companies by revenue at number 153. Its is operational in 6 continents and more than 50 countries worldwide.

As a Recruitment Analyst, I handle end to end recruitments:

1) Supporting the People ,Organization and Support function of Rio Tinto Australia and New Zealand for cost effective recruitment activities.
2) Drafting advertisements for print media and all relevant job portals in Australia like seek and career one and posting them through Taleo
3) Working on Taleo - talent management software powered by Oracle, for sourcing profiles and screening purposes. Also, working on in-house applicant tracking system called "ogre" for candidate tracking across the stages. Using SAP for employee information management.
4) Responsible for creating pool of employable resources for unique and trade roles within different business verticals like Rio Tinto Iron ore, Rio Tinto coal, Rio Tinto Energy and Technology and Innovation
5) Screening of profiles- Desk screening of CVs followed by conducting first round of phone screening of the candidates.
6) Post candidate telephonic interactions preparing candidate feedback sheets and sharing it with the onshore team.
7) Henceforth arranging candidate assessment centres and interviews with the business leads.
8) Conducting Pre Employment checks with the third party provider
9) Drafting offers and contracts for the short listed candidates.
10) Stakeholder Interaction- Having weekly meetings with the onshore team of BRPs (Business Resource Professionals) on the active and forthcoming requisitions/vacancies and strategies to fill the same.

general.description:
John has experience in both commercial and civil dispute resolution, including disputes relating to Construction, Australian Consumer Law and Property. His primary area of practice is in Restructuring and Insolvency, acting for insolvency practitioners and company directors in relation to corporate insolvency, receiverships, liquidation, security enforcement and debt recovery.

John also has experience in commercial insurance, acting for clients in relation to class actions, coverage issues, and large scale disputes arising under the Corporations Act and Personal Property and Securities Act. John was admitted to practice as a solicitor in NSW in April 2017 and to the High Court in December 2017. He has since appeared in the Local, District and Supreme Courts of New South Wales and the Federal Court of Australia.

jobs.description:
In my capacity as a graduate I was fortunate to rotate through three placements, two within Roads and Maritime Services (RMS) and one within the Sydney Metro Project Delivery Office. 
I began at RMS, working within the Toll finance team assisting in daily management accounting and taking ownership of managing certain components of accounts receivable, reconciliations and investigations of chargebacks. 
I then moved to work within the Project Management team of one of the three major contracts for the Sydney Metro North West project. Working within the commercial team I was responsible for reviewing, considering and drafting responses to contractor correspondence and claims in collaboration with SME's, with a primary focus on WH&S compliance. I also assisted in commercial project management including compiling and drafting briefing notes.
I finished my time with TfNSW working in the RMS Prosecutions team. In this role I sought leave of the court and appeared for the prosecution, presenting in Licence Appeals, HVNL sentencing matters and various directions hearings under the supervision of a senior solicitor. This role provided significant development of my advocacy skills, with a key achievement of appearing in excess of 30 matters at the Local Court in one day.
Two Rotations - Real Estate & Construction and Restructuring & Insolvency

Working on the Sydney Metro Project I managed the contracts of the Program Director's office and Stakeholder and Community Liaison teams, assisting the deputy project directors with service provider engagements, advice on government procurement policies and procuring and maintaining contingent recruitment. 
Key responsibilities: 
- Contract management - assisting in tender selection and evaluation processes and the drafting of contracts, preparing, issuing and responding to general correspondence in relation to contracts and, facilitating contract variations. 
- Budgeting and financial management – formulating monthly accruals and financial forecasts alongside reviewing, assessing and processing payment requests, variations, claims and invoices.
- Resource management – liaising with recruitment agencies to source contingent staff and to arrange staff extensions or terminations on existing engagements.
- Organisational maintenance – maintaining records management data, conducting data analysis to evaluate past performance and subsequently developing recommendations. 
Networking and liaison – Maintaining strong relationships with various stakeholders within and outside the government. 

Key achievement: Effective management of over 70 contracts under the approved annual forecast budget.

Maincom is a preferred builder of multiple insurance companies, coordinating the repairs from claim to resolution on insurable claims across Australia. My role within the team was case management and assisting with accounts payable and accounts receivable. 
Key responsibilities: 
- Answer incoming client and external stakeholder calls in a professional and timely manner.
- Review subcontractor invoices against quoted prices.
- Input all subcontractor invoices into the internal data management system.
- Compile debtor invoices and consolidate claims.
- Maintain claims - including following up subcontractors, clients and external stakeholders frequently to ensure expedient resolution of claims.

In my dual role I performed a number of Key responsibilities:
- Administrative support - including collation of data into excel spreadsheets, photocopying, filing
- Assist in the development and promotion of marketing campaigns  
- Maintaining Reception 
- Performing to sales KPIs 
- Establishing and maintaining positive rapport with current and future clients 
- Providing excellent customer service

In my position at Hospitality Marketing concepts I was the first point of contact for both internal and external clients. I solved customer issues and complaints, through taking inbound customer calls and emails, in a polite and timely manner. 
Key responsibilities:
- Respond to clients and external stakeholders calls and emails within KPI. Averaging 100-150 individually solved emails per week, whilst answering a constant inflow of calls. 
- Liaise with the regional sales offices and partner companies to resolve the client complaints as expediently and effectively as possible.
- Establish and maintain positive rapport with the clients and key external stakeholders.
- Administrative support to the South Pacific sales offices and to the Director of operations - I ncluding data input, faxing, photocopying, filing, making travel arrangements, sorting mail and ordering office supplies.

general.headline: Senior Partner | Trade & Transportation Law | Insurance | Litigation & Dispute Resolution
general.description:
If you are an insurer or business leader operating in the transport, logistics, maritime, trade, insurance or shipping sectors, I would be delighted to advise you on any legal aspect of those sectors, as well as associated dispute resolution and commercial litigation.

For more than 40 years, I have acted on a number of high profile shipping cases, such as those resulting from the capsize of the "Gabriella", the grounding of the "Sanko Harvest", the RJ Kirby v Norfold Southern Railway case (US Supreme Court) and the "Mineral Transporter" - Candlewood Navigation case (Privy Council).  As President (the first non-European) and former Vice-President and Executive Councillor of the Comité Maritime International (CMI) and past board member of Sydney Ports Authority and Sydney Ports Corporation, my network and connections across the legal, insurance, logistics, shipping, maritime, trade and transport industries in Australia and globally are extensive. 
 
Chambers and Partners, Doyle's Guide, Legal 500, Who's Who and Best Lawyers have consistently recognised my shipping and maritime, transportation and insurance law expertise. To this end, I have authored numerous articles and had published "Annotated Admiralty Legislation" (1989).
 
Should you wish to discuss how I can support you and your business on shipping, logistics, maritime, trade, transportation, and insurance matters, please contact me via LinkedIn InMail or email me: stuart.hetherington@cbp.com.au

Specialties: Transport, logistics trade and shipping | Trade & Transportation | Author "Annotated Admiralty legislation"| Former Chair of CMI International Working Groups and International Sub-Committees : "Places of Refuge" and "Review of the Salvage Convention 1989".

general.headline: Barrister-at-Law
general.description:
Pandelis Tiliakos is a Barrister at Second Floor Wentworth Chambers.

Pandelis was called to the Bar in 2017. His practice is broad and he accepts briefs in all areas of law including Building & Construction, Commercial & Corporate, Criminal, Equity, Intellectual Property, Personal Injury and Wills & Estates.

Prior to coming to the Bar, Pandelis practiced as an associate solicitor at Willis & Bowring before joining McCulloch & Buggy. During his time as a solicitor, he appeared on behalf of individuals, companies (small, medium and large) and public bodies in civil and criminal matters in the Federal Court of Australia, Federal Circuit Court of Australia, Supreme Court of New South Wales, District Court of New South Wales, Local Court of New South Wales and New South Wales Civil and Administrative Tribunal.

Pandelis was admitted to the Supreme Court of New South Wales in 2013 and the High Court of Australia in 2014. 

He graduated from the University of New South Wales with Bachelor of Laws and Bachelor of Commerce (International Business) degrees.

Pandelis’ special areas of interest include unconscionable dealings in commercial transactions, sentencing methodologies for strictly indictable offences and claims pursuant to s 88K of the Conveyancing Act 1919 (NSW). He has presented several papers on these and other topics. 

Pandelis' other areas of special interest include Insurance law, Sport & Media law and statutory interpretation. 

In his spare time he enjoys football, rugby league and travelling.

Please keep in mind that the information and content on my Page is intended only to provide a summary and general overview on matters of interest. It is not intended to be comprehensive nor does it constitute legal advice. You should always seek legal advice before acting or relying on any information or content found on my Page.

Liability limited by a scheme approved under Professional Standards Legislation.

Pandelis was admitted to the Supreme Court of New South Wales in 2013 and the High Court of Australia in 2014. 

He graduated from the University of New South Wales with Bachelor of Laws and Bachelor of Commerce (International Business) degrees.

Pandelis’ special areas of interest include unconscionable dealings in commercial transactions, sentencing methodologies for strictly indictable offences and claims pursuant to s 88K of the Conveyancing Act 1919 (NSW). He has presented several papers on these and other topics. 

Pandelis' other areas of special interest include Insurance law, Sport & Media law and statutory interpretation. 

In his spare time he enjoys football, rugby league and travelling.

McCulloch & Buggy is a boutique law firm that specialises in litigation, insurance, construction and employment law. It is one of Australia’s oldest legal practices and is regarded as a forerunner in its fields of expertise. McCulloch & Buggy is also widely renowned in the legal industry for its long-standing associations with various international and domestic blue chip organisations. 

Pandelis Tiliakos was employed as a litigation solicitor and practised under the supervision of Richard Oldfield, Executive Lawyer. During the course of his tenure with the firm, Pandelis had sole conduct of over 20 matters in various practice areas including bankruptcy & insolvency, building & construction, commercial & corporate, employment, personal injury, property & strata and wills & estates litigation. He also assisted the firm’s other practitioners in preparing advices, appearing in court, researching, analysing discovered documents, drafting briefs for counsel, preparing evidence and drafting wills. 

Pandelis was a regular face in the Local, District and Supreme Courts of New South Wales and appeared on various occasions in the Federal Court and New South Wales Civil and Administrative Tribunal.

GA Lawyers is a progressive and multi-disciplinary practice based in Kingsgrove. It practices principally in the areas of buildings & construction, business, conveyancing, criminal, estate planning, litigation and personal injury law. 

Pandelis Tiliakos practised under the supervision of George Anton, principal. He had carriage of various litigious matters in the areas of building & construction, commercial, criminal and wills & estates litigation. Pandelis prepared advices, liaised with clients, carried out research, prepared evidence and appeared in court. 

Pandelis would regularly appear in the Local, District and Supreme Court of New South Wales as well as the New South Wales Civil and Administrative Tribunal.

Willis & Bowring has been operating in the Sutherland-Shire since 1960 and is considered one of the largest firms in the region. The firm currently has 5 partners who specialise in their own specific practice area including litigation, family, property law and wills & estates. 

Pandelis Tiliakos practised predominantly in the areas of building & construction, commercial & corporate, criminal and property litigation. He frequently presented papers on these and other areas of law. 

Under the supervision of Don Wright, Partner, Pandelis had carriage of over 50 matters and prepared initial advices, liaised directly with clients, prepared evidence, briefed counsel, conducted mediations and appeared in court for all his matters. 

Pandelis appeared in the Local, District and Supreme Courts of New South Wales as well as the Federal Court and New South Wales Civil and Administrative Tribunal.

general.description:
I work with our high achieving partners, lawyers and business services staff at Colin Biggers
      & Paisley to help our firm be a highly competitive force as a leader in Australia's legal

jobs.description:
In my current role at Colin Biggers & Paisley, I manage a team of 13 high performing marketers who provide strategic and tactical advice and services to our partners and staff across our firm.  

My team and I advise on and manage the firm's business development and marketing requirements, at national and local levels and across a wide range of practice areas. This includes ongoing development and implementation of our firm's strategic marketing program at all levels, as well as day to day management of activities spanning the marketing mix. We work across all practice areas of the firm and in its three office locations, to deliver results to the firm's practices and its clients in Australia and internationally.

As Iskra, I also acted as a member of the Influence Consulting network, to provide corporate and professional organisations with training and coaching in influencing, presentation and communications skills. I worked within the broader Influence Consulting network in Australia and internationally, as part of a network of fellow consultants using our excellent IP and resources to help clients become much more effective in these areas. During this time, my key clients included ANZ Bank, Australia Post, the Australian Corporate Counsel Association, Genesys Consulting, Integria/Todd Group and many others. Influence is a global leader in this area and I am proud to have been associated with them in this space.

I founded and managed Iskra Consulting, a boutique firm specialising in bid coaching and management services for the professional services sector. Iskra focused on the harder edge of business development: this included assisting clients with sales problems, proposal challenges, high stakes pitching situations and 'think on your feet' commercial opportunities. We also helped clients answer the specific and systemic problems that they can often face in these areas. My clients included professional services firms in the mid-size, boutique and 'Big 4' groups for legal, accounting and other related sectors.

I led the business development and marketing function of this national, mid-size law firm. This involved managing a team of seven BD & marketing staff across two offices to develop appropriate BD and marketing strategies, and deliver advice and support services to partners, staff and senior management across Landers' two office locations (Melbourne and Sydney).

I acted as a senior bid and proposals advisor and coach to PwC partners and staff in
      the firm's audit, assurance, tax and advisory divisions. During this time I worked on
      100+ pitches and bids in Australia and internationally, including a three month
      
      secondment to the firm's global office in New York.

I worked closely with KWM's partners to manage the firm's national clients, particularly
      
      in the financial, banking and resources sectors in Sydney and Melbourne.

I was the first national BDM for this highly rated New Zealand law firm. I helped many
      partners and senior staff with their practice building and with broader practice group
      
      and firm-wide BD activities.

This varies with each client allowing me to work with each business owner to get a better understanding of their business and implement a sales/marketing plan. general.description:
Kaitlyn joined the Lander & Rogers Workplace Relations & Safety group in 2011. She has experience in a wide range of areas within the field of workplace relations and employment law assisting clients, both private and public, throughout the various stages of the employment relationship, including:  

• advising employers about restraints of trade and protection of confidential information, and acting in State Supreme Court proceedings to enforce same, including successfully obtaining an Anton Piller order and other interlocutory relief;
• acting for a large manufacturing client regarding its enterprise agreement negotiations, industrial action (protected and unprotected) and picketing in respect of its highly unionised workforce;
• conducting complex and sensitive workplace investigations for private and public sector clients; and
• successfully defending claims and negotiating positive outcomes in discrimination and equal opportunity matters, unfair dismissal claims, adverse action claims and contract claims for a variety of clients, both public and private.

Kaitlyn has a particular interest in anti-discrimination law and has written a handbook on discrimination law for the Victorian Equal Opportunity and Human Rights Commission (Victorian Discrimination Law).  She also provides invaluable drafting assistance to the firm's employer clients, helping to structure business and industry specific contracts and policies to manage risk.

In February 2018, Kaitlyn was recognised in Doyle's Guide Rising Stars - Employment & Workplace Relations, having previously been recognised in September 2015.  Kaitlyn was also a finalist in the Lawyers Weekly "30 under 30" awards for Workplace Relations in May 2015, and in August 2014, was recognised by Australasian Lawyer as a Rising Star in the area of Employment.

general.headline: Servicing clients and growing the business ❂ Business Development Manager at Dentons ❂ Owner and Founder of petit nunu
general.description:
The essence of good marketing & business development is to deliver your customers a positive experience and to create strong relationships which are based on trust.

Many sophisticated tools and technologies, as well as proven methodologies and techniques can help you build and manage your relationships with clients. The relationships you and your organisation maintain with your clients and contacts form the foundation for success.

The one thing that the most advanced systems or processes cannot do for you is to understand the ‘human’ aspect of these client relationships. Every client is unique; the organisation’s objectives and strategies, the market in which it operates and, last but not least, the people who sit across the table from you. My focus is to observe clients’ movements, market developments and trends to help identify opportunities and develop strategies to achieve commercial outcomes for the firm. The experience I have gained working with a variety of clients and contacts in both Switzerland and Australia has helped me to understand how these interactions can create opportunities for growth.

Petit nunu – if you never try, you will never know...

During my career break in 2014, I had the pleasure of being a full-time father to my baby daughter. The benefit of being surrounded by babies and toddlers every day was that I found a market niche I decided to explore further. In October 2014, I launched ‘petit nunu’; a kids' accessory label with a range of 5-panel hats and baseball caps for cool toddlers aged between 6 months and 4 years.

It fills me with pride to see happy customers wearing petit nunu caps.

jobs.description:
It all started with a casual conversation amongst new dads... 

...the journey progressed and the simple idea became a solid business plan. It has been a great experience to translate a simple idea into a solid business plan and develop a top quality product. I still remember my first sketches of the designs and the many long telephone conversations with my suppliers.

In 2015, petit nunu launched its first collection of baseball caps and 5-panel caps for toddlers and kids aged between 6 months and 4 years. And the journey continues with ongoing brand building, social media engagement and sales., sales, sales.

Have a look at our collection on www.petitnunu.com.au

This includes an Instgram Page "The Balanced Lawyer", speaking at events and regular articles.  Claire is also a Director of the Wellbeing and the Law Foundation. 

Claire enjoys writing and has written publications for the Young Lawyers Journal, Australian Medical Journal and Law Institute Journal.

      Victorian Bar (Vic Bar) established in 2013 to raise funds to support the mental health

      students.

Enablr Fundraising brings disruption and innovation to the charity space with the support of Minter Ellison, ANZ  and EY.

Enablr Fundraising is a registered charity offering non-profit, online fundraising solutions to charities in Australia, Hong Kong and the USA. Our solutions are fully comprehensible and aim to save the NFP sector billions of dollars annually by providing an alternative to high cost, inefficient, for-profit oferrings.

HTRAC provides a holistic solution to assist victims of human trafficking, slavery and exploitation in Australia.

 If you are a law firm, lawyer or barrister and would like to know more about joining the HTRAC referral program to represent victims of human trafficking and slavery in Australia on a pro bono basis, or would otherwise like to join HTRAC as a legal volunteer, please get in touch by emailing info@htrac.org.au

 We will be having a launch in early 2016 and if this area is an interest or passion to you we would love your support and attendance on the night

The LIV Young Lawyers (YL) is "a dynamic group established to enhance the legal skills, knowledge and professional networks of members in the early stages of career development."

 I’m excited to lead the LIV Young Lawyers Executive with President, Linda Rayment to help empower law students and young lawyers to make their mark in the legal profession.

Our main focus as the LIV YL President will be on Mentoring, Marketing, Motivation, Leadership and Justice. We together with the YL Executive will be creating workshops, seminars, and training programs focused on practical assistance in these areas. We have some exciting initiatives that are in the pipeline, and I can't wait to share them with you in the near future. 

 If you are interested in joining any of the LIV Young Lawyers Committees, or finding out about LIV Young Lawyers, please email younglaw@liv.asn.au

jobs.jobTitle: YLS Co-Chair of the Community Issues Committee
jobs.description:
The aim of the Community Issues Committee (CIC) is to facilitate young lawyers' involvement in community-building projects, provide education about social issues, and support for young lawyers wanting to create or contribute to social projects. We also aim to raise funds for local charities, and have a special interest in promoting health and well-being among young lawyers.
 
We are excited to work with committee members to present various projects in 2014, including:
 - A film screening event focusing on human trafficking in Melbourne, including speakers from Project Respect. 
- A hot topics seminar on "Children in Immigration Detention" moderated by Julian Burnside.
 - Green Practice Project and LIJ column.
 - The creation of an ongoing specialised human trafficking taskforce, where we will work together with experts such as police officers, NGO workers and barristers to help eliminate human trafficking in Australia. 

If you would like to get involved check out http://www.liv.asn.au/LIV-Young-Lawyers/Get-Involved or email younglaw@liv.asn.au

jobs.description:
Cheryl has extensive experience in the full breadth of trade mark matters and associated legal issues and disputes. 

Cheryl has a particular interest in assisting business owners clear, register and enforce their new business name, brand name or service/product names. This includes determining whether a potential name is available for use in the marketplace and registration on the Trade Mark Register and advising on possible filing strategies in Australia and overseas in order to obtain the strongest and broadest protection. 

Cheryl has professional experience in-house having worked as legal counsel on secondment for a major Australian telecommunication company. 

Cheryl regularly presents workshops to new business owners on trade mark matters, including online branding issues. 

Cheryl is a prize winning graduate of the University of Melbourne's internationally recognised Master of Intellectual Property Law, winning the Pinkerton Scholarship for being the top student in International Issues in Intellectual Property Law. She also has a Honours degree of Bachelor of Laws and Legal Practice from Flinders University.

“From the first conversation I had with Cheryl, I was impressed by her approach, friendliness, professionalism and upfront explanation of the costs and processes involved in a trade mark application. I have dealt with a hundreds of professionals and on this occasion I thought it to be worthwhile providing positive feedback for an exceptionally professional service provided by Cheryl. We also had no hesitation recommending Cheryl to another friend of ours also looking to setup a business name and apply for a trade mark. Whilst many law firms provide trade mark application services, for Nicola and I, Cheryl stood out to us with her consistently friendly, approachable and genuine engagement with us throughout the entire process.” Anthony Collins, Kids at Max Pty Ltd

jobs.description:
Justin is involved in the prosecution of patents and registered designs, the drafting of patent specifications and patent oppositions, as well as providing advice on validity and patent infringement, with over 14 years' experience in the patent attorney profession. In addition to regular patent attorney work, Justin also has experience in managing the firm's overseas filings department, responsible for establishing foreign patent applications for local clients. He completed Engineering and Science degrees at the University of Melbourne where he was awarded a Dean of Engineering Scholarship. In the final year of his Engineering degree, Justin's research and design projects were in the fields of energy conservation and utilisation and finite element analysis. In the Science faculty, he undertook computer science and a major in applied and industrial mathematics. Justin has been a guest lecturer on the topic of intellectual property to engineering students at RMIT University, Melbourne for several years. He has also participated as a judge in the Engineers Australia Excellence Awards in 2009 and 2011.

Justin's experience in the fields of automotive and marine engineering includes drafting and prosecution of patent applications in Australia and overseas for an extensive range of devices/processes, including a multi-speed automatic automotive transmission having adaptive control strategies, a double clutch transmission (DCT), an energy-efficient torque converter, conversions for providing wheelchair access to vehicles, vehicle stabilising and levelling systems, a hybrid marine drive and a braking system with improved pad wear characteristics.

He also has experience in obtaining, enforcing and advising on registered design rights in a range of areas including luggage, food packaging, adhesive containers and dispensers, swimwear and electric vehicle components.
